intro: Calochortus venustulus, commonly known as the showy globemallow, is a flowering plant native to California and adjacent regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, often in areas with full sun exposure. Its leaves are usually succulent and fleshy, adapted to conserve water in arid environments. Calochortus venustulus is a perennial herb that produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
